column1: The headquarters of Carlson are in Minnetonka. The headquarters of Cargill are located in Minnetonka and are in the Wayzata Post Office area. Founded in 1865
column2: Cargill is the largest privately held corporation in the U.S. in terms of revenue. Other companies based in Minnetonka include Radisson Hotel Group and the uniform companies AmeriPride Services and G&K Services.

Minnetonka has evolved from heavily wooded wilderness through extensive farming and thriving industrialization to its present primarily residential suburban character.

column1: The Minnetonka area was home to the Dakota and Ojibwe Native American tribes before Euro-Americans arrived in the 1800s.  They believed Lake Minnetonka (mni meaning water
column3: anglicized to Minnetonka) and the land around it to be sacred.  The first recorded exploration of the area by Euro-Americans was in 1822
column4: when a group from newly constructed Fort Snelling made its way up Minnehaha Creek (then known as Brown's Creek or Falls Creek) to the lake.  In 1851
column5: the Dakota sold the area including Minnetonka to the United States with the Treaty of Traverse des Sioux.  The first census
column7: lists 41 households. Twenty-nine of the heads of households are listed as farmers.  The occupations of the remaining twelve are associated with the operations of Minnetonka Mill and a nearby hotel.In 1852
column8: a claim was staked on Minnehaha Creek near McGinty Road.  The sawmill that was constructed in the thick woods of maple
column11: red cedar and basswood was the first privately operated mill in Minnesota west of the Mississippi River.  Oak timbers from this mill were used to build the first suspension bridge across the Mississippi River at Saint Anthony Falls in 1853.  The settlement of Minnetonka Mills that grew up around the mill was the first permanent European–American settlement west of Minneapolis in Hennepin County.  In 1855
column12: a two-story sawmill was constructed with a furniture factory on the second floor. A building for varnishing furniture was built on the south side of the creek

column1: The city of Minnetonka is covered by three independent school districts. The Hopkins School District
column2: which encompasses the central and eastern part of Minnetonka; the Minnetonka School District
column3: in the western part of city north of Lake Minnetonka; and the Wayzata School District
column4: which covers an area along the northern boundary of the city. Some students attend public schools in other school districts chosen by their families under Minnesota's open enrollment statute.

column1: The City Council of Minnetonka consists of the mayor and six council members. Of the six council members
column2: two are elected at large and the remaining four are elected from wards. The council exercises the legislative power of the city and determines all matters of policy. It has the responsibility of basic decisions for the community
column3: including appointment of the city manager. The city manager is responsible for putting council policies into effect and administering affairs of city government.The United States Postal Service operates the Minnetonka Post Office and the Minnetonka Carrier Annex. In addition
column4: Minnetonka is served by four zip codes: one representing Minnetonka (55345)
